inn1.comm: off the mark with a straight drive and roared all the way
a strong muscled drive and they come back for an easy two
a drive out to mid-off, but straight to the fielder
pushed through on the off-side once more
tight line once more, on off, a good length, and it's defended strongly on the front foot
good length again, pitching just outside off and some delicious shape away - but the batsman's not moved, letting the ball through
too wide outside off, no footwork there as Gilchrist drives hard through the covers - that was pure timing
straight ball, at 145kph, up there and defended from outside off with a sturdy shot
swivelled right onto the dot by Malinga, the batsman moving into the line on off and defends right behind the ball on the back foot
outside off, a good length, but worked on the back foot with a touch to mid-off
great length, pushed past the left hander and brushed just past the outside edge down the corridor
on off, more good length, and defended tidily
up there outside off, the batsman looks to squeeze it out to midwicket with a turn of the wrist but stops on the shot
at 121.9kph, good-length ball again, on off, and defended once more
came back in off the seam from just outside off to in line with the off-stump and the ball defended yet again
comes forward, looking to defend, gets a thick outside edge through the third man region, controlled down so no alarms
overpitched on leg, and you can't bowl there to him, the batsman quick to bring his hands down on to the ball, clunking it out to midwicket and they come back for two
not a moment for Hayden to treasure, coming out, looking to drive through extra and stops on the shot, an action which scoops the ball up invitingly but without too much alarm
overpitched on off and Gilchrist gets down on one knee and swings the ball through the covers with a full follow-through
"Wait, no" comes the cry as Gilchrist lashes the ball to mid-off hard, and it's well picked up
pushed across the left hander, with a touch of away movement too and played down off the back foot to the gully region where it's well picked up by Dilshan with a left-hand stretch of a dive
on off, worked into short midwicket
straighter delivery on off, the batsman straightens up to get inside the line of the ball and defends
extra pace from Malinga, straight and short, Hayden tangles himself up looking to bunt it from outside off through midwicket, doesn't get over it whatsoever and the ball scoops up to Farveez Maharoof
short on off, defended on the back foot into the covers
short on off again and played back down
shortish ball on off, pushed towards mid-off and calls them through for the single, it's a far from comfortable one though, mind, as Jayasuriya comes round and throws towards the non-striker's sticks
on off, short, and played out to point in a half-defensive manner
across the right hander who comes down without convincing as his bat skews in his hands as he defends on the front foot
defended again
defended straight back to the bowler this time
outside off, driven to mid-off and there's no chance of a run
short outside off and cut down off the back foot to short point where Dilshan tidies up well and gets a low-five from Kapugedera for his efforts
outside off, a touch short, and it's a vintage Gilchrist - enjoy them while you can - a hard drive through the covers
overpitched this time, outside off, pushed to mid-off and there's a hard, quick run called through by Gilchrist with a "Yeahyeahyeahyeah"
a height-related wide, banged in very short and it goes very high - more than a metre above his head even if he was standing up, but Ponting ducks just for good measure
no appeal as the ball cuts back in from outside off and catches the inside edge
outside off, and pushed into the covers
stays over the wicket, pushes that past the right hander
pushed past him again, the ball moving away off the pitch wider past the right hander whose leave is extravagant
down on one knee to greet the ball outside off, swishes it with a flick through midwicket. He didn't have much room for that but it goes to the ropes
outside off, rising delivery, worked wide of mid-off and they run through an easy single
room outside off and Ponting launches into that one with a flaying, flowing drive through the covers. Great shot, he's already looking more comfortable
on off, tidy delivery and defended on the back foot
room outside off in theory but the length's too good, cramping Gilchrist whose hand comes off the bat as he looks to push to point
more room, tries to work hard to the covers, but plays right into the ground
pushed up there on off, played down
on middle and off, well bowled again, and all the batsman can do is defend in front of his stumps
pushed across the left hander, room outside off, Gilchrist chops into the ground and that rounds off an excellent maiden
right up there on off, and played forward for yet another dot
defended on the back foot
short on off and once again defended on the back foot
slower ball, coming back in and once more defended
driven hard to the covers, where it's snapped up
turned off the legs to midwicket for the only single off the over
outside off, driven hard to mid-off, but straight to the player
terrific shot for Ponting, getting over the ball on the off-side and pushed in front of midwicket to shake off the single-figures bogey
a better delivery this time, Ponting caught in two minds going for the pull shot, cramped and pushed in front of midwicket
got that one away with an inside edge in front of square, trying to drive forward. Malinga's bowling too straight - especially given his off-side field
short ball banged in straight and Ponting somehow gets the bottom of the bat on it and he pulls it round through the 45
laced hard to point this time
outside off and the ball was at the rope almost as soon as it had been hit, Gilchrist lacing it square through point
a hint of curl away as the ball pitches on a good length on off
pushed up there on a good line and length, driven back out through straight mid-off to bring up the fifty
a huge outside edge dashes just wide of a diving first slip there, Jayawardene, the bowler doing well with the ball that shaped across him on a good length
defended this time
comes right out and defends strongly this time on off
overpitched on off, a cracking shot of a forward drive to mid-off, the fielder doing really well to come round, dive and roll - that was Dilshan with fast hands
hello, a controlled lofted drive over long-on that travels fast and flat two rows back
cuts hard to point
flays hard straight to midwicket where Malinga tidies up now
didn't time this one to mid-off
short outside off, and ever so nearly a six as Gilchrist goes aerial again with another lofted drive, this time over straight long-on. He doesn't have to go does he?
Ponting gets across but doesn't play either forward or back, instead guiding the ball to Jayawardene at first slip, who had predicted his downfall before this match
superb delivery, how about that one for a greeter? Bangs it in just short on miffle and the ball was through him, nipping off and away from him. Cracker
gets down and defends this time, and they shuffle through
strays on to the legs and turned round sharply through fine
short outside off, a touch of extra bounce, and Gilchrist leaps into the line to defend down off the back foot
outside off and well bowled, slowed down a touch and the pace deceiving Gilchrist who drags an inside edge back past the leg stump
waits to see what the bowler's got, and he's got a ball which pitches on middle and off and invites the batsman to defend on the back foot, right back down the line
on middle and leg this time, swivelled round to square, at least that was the intention, the ball instead dropping down off the edge
slower ball, yorker too, well dug out towards straight long-on where there's some good, committed fielding there
horrible effort from Clarke there, coming out of his crease, flashing really hard and totally missing down the corridor
good judgement from Clarke this time, the ball cutting back a touch from outside off and leaping over the off bail, clearing it by some distance
another play-and-miss rounds off a good over by the bowler, Clarke's feet once again trapped as he looks to lash through the covers
comes right  out and works the ball into short midwicket
outside off, good length, Gilchrist waits and defends on the front foot
good length again, up there, and defended on the back foot into the off-side
right up there in front of off, played into the ground onto the leg-side with a powerless drive
pushed across the right hander, who dinks to short cover on the back foot and shouts what sounds like "No, mate"
swing into the right hander from a ball which starts on middle and leg and ends up just outside leg, played down into short midwicket
on middle and leg, worked into short miwicket, Vaas throws himself down to stop it
outside off, defended on the back foot
on middle and leg, driven out to mid-on and Clarke implores his partner to "Wait on"
outside off, driven hard through mid-off with the full face of the blade and a high elbow
out of the crease again, on the back foot, and plays hard to Kapugedera just foward of point who does well once more
comes out and defends on the front foot
over the wicket, defended on the back foot in line with the ball
outside off, played on the up just short of Malinga at mid-off, a touch of pop there
right up there on off, a touch of movement in the air, defended on the front foot
right up there again on leg this time, played on the front foot into the leg side and no run's on
pushed out to mid-on this time and they run through
ripped through on a good line and length, just past the outside edge
right up there and played forward in a defensive manner
across the left hander at a tight angle, Gilchrist goes back and pushes to short midwicket, there's no run but there is a good throw in from the fielder to the non-striker's
comes forward again, always attacking, but drives straight to the fielder at mid-off
short and what a way to bring up the fifty, everyone's on their feet as he pulls hard, great eye there, in front of square
up there on leg, works into short midwicket and calls "No" loudly
up there and played off the back foot, defensively
across the right hander, worked into the covers
on leg, driven back out to the bowler without much power
comes out of the crease, driven to the covers
lets that one go across him, outside off and nips wider off the seam
pushed straight to the covers, Clarke finding it hard to find the gaps, and that's well bowled again
Clarke sets to defend and does so on the front foot
short and pulled round through wide of midwicket
right up there, overpitched though, driven hard and true along the floor through long-off
played off the legs into midwicket
nipped back in from outside off, pushed out to mid-on
banged in down a good length but wide outside off, and pulled hard but mistimed up to the circle on leg, wide of mid-on
comes out and drives to mid-off
Murali dances slowly up to the sticks, as usual, and plants the ball on a good length in line with off, Gilchrist defends
pushed across him again and driven out straight to mid-off, with cheers from the crowd as the hundred comes up
down leg, swivelled off the legs behind square for a gentle single
outside off, turns in a touch, and Clarke guides the ball out on the front foot with an easy drive to the legs
outside leg, pitches there, and comes back in to middle, a half-shout
on leg, turned round behind square
low full toss drops towards the off-stump and it's driven back out to mid-off, didn't quite get hold of it
round the wicket by the way, Gilchrist drives into the ground once more outside off
on middle and leg, Gilchrist picks it off a full length and pulls round hard behind square
short ball down off has Clarke pulling out of any thoughts of playing it, with a sway back
driven into the gap in the covers for a quick single
starts wideish of the crease, sends one down off and it nips back in a touch, defended on the front foot
down leg, and turned into the leg-side quietly, no run there
fizzes it outside off, good length, pushed into the covers off the back foot with a gentle dab
fuller delivery, and a better line outside off, straightening through, Gilchrist on the back foot pushes into the covers
worked forward for a comfortable single
comes out and controls the push back out in front of midwicket
cuts hard over the ball, away from the body, and didn't quite get hold of it, not connecting at all in fact
tremendous shot, the ball served up outside off and without bouncing, Gilchrist helps himself to a full-blooded drive through the covers
tucked from outside off, off the legs to midwicket
outside off, a touch full, and driven out to mid-off
outside off and Clarke doesn't get hold of the pull shot, a la Hayden earlier, just rushed on to that one and it lands short of midwicket
the bowler gets away with one which bends in at the left hander on the full and is laced to the covers
outside off, full delivery pitches just in front of his toes, not quite a yorker, and he drives into the ground, the ball bouncing up and landing in front of mid-off
plenty of loop there, Clarke shuffles out to drive to the off, and they run through an easy single
stays over, Gilchrist comes out and makes that one a decent-length delivery with a drive forward
unconvincing from Gilchrist this time as he gets down, takes it from outside off and sweeps right into the ground
a tidy defence from Clarke who leans right over the ball and shows the full face of his bat
outside off and this time Clarke steers the ball through gully
right up there on a good length outside off, the batsman gets right over the ball and defends
on leg, drags it a touch short and Gilchrist tucks it fine off the legs through down to fine leg
defended on the front foot now
dropped, rather, no attempt was made as Gilchrist tucks it high off his hips over to deep fine leg and Malinga has a refusal, not going for the dive forward
knocked forward this time
straight ball on middle and off, the batsman jumps into the line and defends back down off the back foot
driven back out to mid-off this time
outside off, pushed off the back foot through the covers, the fielder just getting a hand to it
they'll settle for the single through mid-off now
outside off, great use off the feet as the batsman rocks back and cuts well through the covers, Jayasuriya does the fielding
outside leg, hardly any turn, Gilchrist gets over it and knocks the ball to midwicket
looped in again and worked out to short midwicket
fired right up there on middle, defended on the front foot
low full toss, tucked off the toes on the front foot through midwicket
outside off, the ball rose and Clarke nearly chops an inside edge back on the stumps as he cuts on the back foot
nips back in from outside off, the batsman waits and defends forward
outside off, slower than Clarke was expecting, so he waits and adjusts to the wideish delivery, playing it into the covers
right up there on off, tidy delivery, Gilchrist defends back down then rehearses the force through mid-on
on leg, a touch short, Gilchrist wrists it off the hips behind square and Malinga tidies up
wide outside off, tempts Gilchrist to cut the air and nearly take the edge
driven hard to the covers this time, stopped by the fielder
down the track and Clarke drives out to mid-on, just working the ball around here
on middle, Gilchrist waits and heaps it in front of midwicket with an easy back-foot steer
on middle, turned off the legs in front of midwicket
outside off, full ball, Gilchrist meets with a front-foot defensive
outside off, driven to the covers

outside off, driven hard to the covers, Gilchrist is out of his crease but sent back firmly by Clarke, a good call but nearly too late as Jayawardene nearly shies down the stumps. He would have been out
driven forward once more, still no run
nipped back in from outside off, played on the front foot with defensive intent
slower ball outside off and Clarke smashes it through extra cover on the front foot, using the extra length well. The ball appeared to speed up as it reached the rope
good recovery, tight, driven to the covers and they run through, the ball again coming to Gilchrist's end as he makes his ground
down the corridor outside off, good length, Clarke lets it fly through
good yorker, up there on off, and the batsman clamps the ball into the covers on the front foot
bangs it in down off, the ball pitching and moving out a touch off the seam, the batsman chasing after it with a back-foot cut and the ball flies over
good swing up there, the yorker again moving onto the legs, and dug out with a last-gasp bat
on off, waits and defends back down off the back foot
on middle, another would-be yorker and Clarke punctures the pressure with a lovely guide off the legs in front of midwicket
turned off the legs and that's the Australia superstition, 87, which is 13 from 100
down leg, Gilchrist follows it, a tad too late, luckily for him as he didn't get a touch on it
pushed into the covers
nips back in from outside off, pushed into the covers
played forward
leaps on to the back foot to defend back into the covers
on off and middle, turned off the legs in front of square
overpitched on off and Gilchrist drives forward straight through mid-off and it's picked up inside the long-off rope
up there on off, pushed into the covers on the front foot, Gilchrist just about in his crease as the throw came through
outside off, dug out into the covers
Clarke turns his body to meet that one on leg and defends on the front foot
backs away and Malinga follows him outside leg, Clarke squaring up behind it with a front-foot defensive
short ball on leg fires into Clarke's rib-cage and he is in some pain as he falls to the floor immediately having missed the defensive
straight delivery, the batsman goes into line and defends off the back foot
down leg, Gilchrist turns it down fine to fine leg where Sangakkara runs down to pick it up
outside leg and a brave Clarke soldiers on, turning that one down fine
on middle and leg, rising, played back down towards the bowler off the back foot
slower delivery, turned off the legs to short midwicket and there was a single there but Clarke sends him back, Maharoof finding the mix-up amusing - Clarke is keen not to run Gilchrist out right now
pushed to the covers, picks out the fielder there
up there and defended on the front foot
full low delivery up there on off, played off the front foot to mid-on
pushes Gilchrist on to his back foot and hs turns it into short midwicket
outside off, Clarke backs away, exposes his stumps and cuts it to point
on off, nipped a touch away off a good length, worked into the off-side
comes down and drives out to mid-on where there was nearly another mix-up, instead they decide not to go for the second
defended on the front foot
goes to pull it through midwicket, gets the toe-end of the bat on what's hardly a fully struck pull
outside off, rises up and is defended back down
on off, rises up and is tucked down into the covers, they run through
outside off, Gilchrist flashes hard at a cut, didn't get the top edge, contrary to Sangakkara's vociferous appeal
drags it short, cut hard through point to bring up a strike-stealing single
pushes softly into the covers and shouts "Yesyes" to call Clarke through
beautiful doosra and out comes Clarke, drawn forward, and off come the bails, Sangakkara quicker than a whippet
squirts down leg, Symonds turns it in front of a lunging square and gets off the mark immediately
an appeal as one pitches on leg and turns a bit more, the half-appeal not given
comes out and turns off the legs to short midwicket
outside off, doesn't really turn back in, Symonds steps out and pushes into the covers
short ball, released straight and the batsman ducks as it goes through to the keeper
bobs his head under a straight, sharp and short one, and it's no-balled because of the height
right up there and defended on the front foot
pitches on off and middle on a good length, moves back in a touch, defended on the front foot
outside off, cuts hard at a wideish one, but under the ball and a woody-sounding click travels on to the keeper who takes a good tumbling catch low
outside off, pushed to mid-off and pinches a single naughtily to Murali
outside off, a cut, but can only pick out the covers, so he will have the strike next over
outside off, waits, and keeps the crowd guessing with a defensive on the back foot
he's got is this time! This is his century! He turns it from outside off to midwicket and the crowd cheer long and loud
worked into the covers on the front foot but they settle for one
straight, full, and worked out in front of midwicket this time
floated past him, the batsman coming out to meet it, Sangakkara gets the bails off but has he done so in time? The third umpire reckons he has, Hussey's back foot somehow straight back down
a touch of turn, squeezed back out to the covers
waits on the back foot and defends there
pushed up there again and defended forward
starts from wide of the crease, angles it back on a good length outside off, defended back down
digs a yorker out to mid-off and it's tidied up well
on middle and leg, good length, squeezed into midwicket
straight one up there on middle and defended forward
comes right out but kills the ball now with a creeping defence
drags it short and Gilchrist pulls hard in front of midwicket
tight defence up there, squeezed down to gully
plenty of loop and Gilchrist comes out of his crease to drive hard wide of extra cover
down the track, mistimes a drive out to mid-off
big air again, driven through Murali's legs, a nutmeg, and out to long-off where there's some sloppy fielding which allows an exta run
shortish ball and that one goes very high and very long into the hill over at deep square leg
low full toss driven hard straight to cover like a rocket
outside off, late swing, cut down through third man and that was possibly a chance, ah but it didn't carry to the keeper
pushes him back, but he drives back out forward to mid-off to bring up the 200
fuller ball on off, driven up and over towards mid-on
outside off, cut down to third man for a single
a premeditated reverse sweep for Hussey there and a clean gathering for the keeper could have been close stumping-wise
worked out forward for a quick single
dropped by Kapugedera coming in off the rope at deep midwicket, he was a bit lazy coming in and drops it on the crouch
defended forward
Hussey tries to reverse sweep, then turns hockey player as he tries to dribble it back round
driven out to mid-on
opens the face to guide the ball down to third man to bring Gilchrist back on strike
Gilchrist is finally gone, trying to loft one over long-off and took a leading edge to the covers, Kapugedera holding on this time over his head, having dropped him last over
left alone outside off, a wide veers wider
pushed through down the channel
dropped. Tharanga has put down a sitter at midwicket, the ball circling round his hands like on a roulette wheel, and he hangs his head in shame
bouncer, and he ducks under
comes forward, squares up and the ball takes an outside edge but safe
defended forward now
down the track, a mistimed pull again from him
worked well for two through square and they collect an overthrow too, Jayasuriya has something to say about it, the bowler was nowhere near behind the stumps
right up there on the back foot, pushed into the covers and they run through the single
a swing and a miss for one outside off, Hussey trying to sweep to midwicket but gets it wrong
down the track and again unconvincing, the ball catching his thigh guard as he swivels, the ball bouncing just in front of the keeper
goes for a huge aerial drive which isn't properly timed and so falls short of wide mid-on
lifted from a short one outside off high and higher - the ball catching the toe end - and goes on over towards Jayasuriya who clings on, making no mistake
the single is squeezed out to mid-off, so Hogg will face his first ball
outside off, defended back down off the back foot, tidy delivery there
a single into the covers brings Hussey back onto strike
full ball outside off, a single pushed to mid-off and they set off immediately
slower ball, driven out to the covers for yet another single
sharp bouncer well directed over middle, the batsman ducked accordingly
on middle and leg, tucked down off the back foot towards mid-off
on off and middle, shortish, tucked round to midwicket and they look for two
backed away behind the stumps, smart piece of bowling, as the ball followed him and he tried to run it out off the bat through third man on the rise but took the glove
short and straight again, the batsman once more tries to run it fine and nearly helps it into Sanga's gloves, but didn't quite connect
backs away and away and cuts hard but without completely timing it
outside off, slightly short, and Hussey launches that high and very straight, right over the long-off ropes
tight ball, typical Malinga, up there on middle, defended forward
banged in short, the batsman backs away and cuts into the covers
bowled him this time, Hogg backing away yet again and the perfect yorker cleans him up, clattering into all three stumps - strike.
good ball to greet Lee, short and sharp and Lee does well to sway back from it
short and bounces up off the glove, landing safe
Hussey looks to hit across the line rather than straight and his would-be pull goes up instead to the covers where Jayawardene sets himself to take a straightforward catch
outside off, horrible shot really, no footwork from Lee who swings and misses away from his body, aiming for the topspin lob
outside off and Lee's swing connects this time with a drive to long-off where a good defensive throw keeps them to a single
rising outside off, pushed out to mid-off and a straight throw from Dilshan crashes down the stumps to run out Johnson
worked into midwicket this time
yorker, dug out straight
Bracken backs right away and was ready on the on-side but in came the slower ball and Malinga just slunk it down off, ever so nearly taking the stumps
ungainly swing and miss, trying to work it to the on-side

follows him down leg, swing and miss from more backing away, they take the bye which is naughty and Sangakkara's huge underarm loop one-two with Malinga nearly results in the run-out at the non-striker's
cleaned up with another excellent yorker to finish the tail off well, Lee backing away, and Malinga firing in on leg stump

inn2.comm: What a start! full and on the pads, Dilshan cutely flicks it over backward square leg for a four, superb innovation at the top of the order
short of a length and straight this time, Dilshan on the back foot and defending down the ground
runs flowing freely here, they take a quick leg-bye to Haddin but a direct hit deflects off the stumps and runs away down the ground for four. Too easy first up.
spanked with the force of a marauder, short and wide from Lee and Jayasuriya upper-cuts it for four, a silence descends over the WACA, Sri Lanka on a roll
wide again and Jayasuriya whacks it over the covers again, what a flood first up, lobs onto the outfield and they get three
short and slightly wide, 147kph, left alone, what an opening over for Sri Lanka, 16 off it.
full and on off, cramped a bit for room, patted to the leg side
full and on middle this time, no room for Jayasuriya, 134kph but accurate, pushed back down the ground
straight again, pushed towards cover
good accurate bowling again, full and no room, pushed down the ground to mid-off
down the leg side and tucked away, four good balls and this one, slightly off the mark, has been put away, trickles away to fine leg for four
on the pads and cramping him for room this time, deflects off the legs
full and on off, Jayasuriya pushes to mid-off and races for a single
what a blitzer, full and on off, Dilshan smokes it off the front foot, super cover-drive for four and the WACA is too stunned here. Sri Lanka galloping away
short and pacy, 145kph, Dilshan goes for the pull shot but doesn't read the length well, deflects off the pads to the slip cordon
on the middle stump, batsman tries to force it to the leg side but he's cramped for room, sees the ball drop close to him
short one from Lee, but that's a no-ball, Dilshan lets it go but sees the umpire signals a free-hit. Time to throw caution to the wind
another short one, and a pull this time, ferociously latches on to it, can't time it well and picks up a couple to fine leg
short of a length, punched off the back foot

he's thrown it away, Jayasuriya charges down the track and tries to smack Bracken over extra-cover, can only get a thick outside edge, though, and pops a simple catch to third man. The fielder there is alert and nabs one of the most important wickets. Needless shot after such a good start. But Bracken won't be complaining

full and angled away towards the covers, brilliant stop by Symonds (who else?) and Hussey picks it up in a flash and tries to throw towards the non-striker's end, Dilshan would have had to go if that was a direct hit
slightly outside off, left alone
pushed off the back foot, down the ground
nice carry to the wicketkeeper, left alone again
exquisite and four all the way, full and outside off, Sangakkara leans into the shot and creams it through the covers for a beautiful four, all along the carpet for a four
rusty start there, big wide outside off from Johnson, he's bowling against the wind so he will need to get used to that
full and tapped to cover, the crowd thinks it's a catch but that was actually a bump ball, Symonds fumbles initially and gets in a direct hit, no point running on a misfield to him

castled! 142kph from Johnson and that's a yorker length ball that swings in late, Dilshan goes for the expansive drive but is beaten all ends up, through the gate, door and kitchen onto the middle and off stump. That sound of ball hitting stumps (tling) isn't going to please Dilshan. The WACA is on fire.
full and on off, Jayawardene pushes to the covers and thinks of a run but Symonds is prowling there, dives and stops the single
left alone outside off, angling from the left-armers angle away from the right-hander
short and nippy this time, 142kph, Jayawardene hurried by that one, drops his bottom hand right at the end as the ball trickles to the covers
short of a length and pacy again, thick outside edge but along the ground to third man for a single, fine over from Johnson
short of a length and hurrying Jayawardene, pushed to the leg side but no run

super shot, Lee digs it in slightly short but Jayawardene is upto the challenge, flicking his wrists and lifting over the slips for four, the third man is a bit too wide and he can't get to it. Good use of Lee's pace from Mahela that time
defended on the back foot
short of a length, pushed to the covers but there are usually no gaps there with Symonds lurking
good length and a bit wide, laced away superbly off the back foot but Hussey is at point, stopping what was a certain four
defended down the ground, not much pace off the pitch, looks like a good one for batting
full and on middle stump, Sangakkara walks across and whips it towards square leg. No single, though
full and on middle stump again, Sangakkara is too wristy a player to miss out, smacks it towards midwicket for three
loose drive outside off, that ball was bowled to induce that shot, Mahela not moving his feet there
left alone, short of a good length ball outside off
straight and accurate, pushed off the back foot back to the bowler

dropped, by Ponting at second slip, Jayawardene flashes loosely, not much feet movement there and gets a healthy edge that flies towards second slip, Ponting lunges towards it but can only parry it away (goal-keeper style) to the third man region. Four more but a lucky one
full and on off, spanked through cover for a gorgeous four, Sangakkara on the move here
full and on middle, clipped away towards midwicket for three, super shot again

full and on middle and leg, fast one there, Lee is confident of the lbw appeal but the umpire is not convinced, Jayawardene indicates that he might have got an inside edge to that one, that looked close
lazy and elegant and sensational, few batsmen drive better than this man and he's creamed Lee towards the covers for four
flashed hard and a thick edge flies away to third man for a single
pushed to the off side, off the back foot
left alone outside off
full and outside off, smashed to the covers but well fielded by Haddin, diving stop and a quick return
cramped for room, deflects off the pads to the off side
short and wide, Sangakkara latches on ferociously, moves into position and finds the gap through the covers, all the way for four, burns the grass
wafting outside off this time, they're throwing their bats at everything, thick edge past the slip to third man for a single
outside off and left alone
pushed to the off side
full and on off, pushed back to the bowler
left alone outside off
outside off again, Sangakkara shoulders arms
slightly slower this time, 127kph, pushed to the covers
and a maiden, shoulders arms and leaves it alone
forced across the right hander from over the wicket, enough angle on that to be left alone, which he does with a shrug
pushed through tighter this time, on the rise and with a hint of curve away - like a supermodel's hips, so not much - and left alone
outside off, dragged short and with plenty of room for him to latch onto a thunderous drive that races over the turf backward of point
pushed across him once more, a touch of room and some width, again he goes square with a drive just in front of point now

but he's gone now, just as he was getting set, the ball pushed across him making him play, hint of movement off the seam and with some late swing once he was committed to the shot, taking a step and thick-edging to second slip where Ponting makes no mistake
leaves his first ball through to the keeper
tight, ever so tight on off, forcing the front-foot defensive to a decent-length ball
left armer to left hander, pushed down straight outside off, Sangakkara waits and defends on the front foot
nipped back fro outside off, pushed to mid-on and they get the single, Hogg has a go at the non-striker's end, it wouldn't have been out and the ball runs on for four overthrows
defended on the front foot
through him as he stabds a forward defensive and there's a cry from a noise as the bat hit the pad, certainly not the ball which leapt over the shoulder
a more convincing forward defensive this time
outside off, Sangakkara comes forward and almost yorks himself outside the line to defend
devious swing back in towards the left hander but the ball's still just down the channel
down the channel again, more swing, the batsman is quick to shoulder arms and hold his bat high for a while making sure the ball has gone through. It had and then some
winged down off once more, a fraction wider, but the same results from the batsman - a leave
late swing away from the left hander, a good length too, and he waits before defending on the front foot
closer to the batsman this time, on off, rising and Sangakkara quickly kills any threat with a doughty defence
slipped through down off
once more across the right hander at 135kph, left alone again
tight line on off, the batsman cautious in front-foot defence
swing back in to the right hander who defends on the front foot
outside off, a swing and a miss of a cut away from his body

outside off and there's a contender for catch of the season, Silva lashes a full-blooded cover drive to Symonds who pulls off an audacious take, diving low and really stretching out his left hand to get under it
defended first up
more good defence
steps outside the crease, and to the side, to defend on the front foot. Good ball there
over the wicket by the way, pushed across to him, defended again
pushed across him, plugging a tight line, and defended on the front foot
more of the same, a pushed defence travelling back to the bowler who scoops it up and looks for opportunities
short ball, good thinking, took him high and on the glove but the ball falls to ground and they scaramble through for one
pushed through outside off
bent back in from outside off, shuttling off the seam, and it's left
cut back in off the seam from an already slender line, Sangakkara defends solidly on the front foot
nips in again, keeping a very tight line, defended forward
pushes it through fuller, and demands a forward defence again
defended on the front foot
defended on the front foot
more defence
cuts back in a smidgen from outside off into line with off and the batsman defends on the back foot now
outside off, waits, and cuts down just wide of the slips, a controlled steer too
walks across the stumps, drives out on leg towards long-on
starts well enough
veering down leg, turned well round to fine leg
short ball, well bowled
outside off, cut down off the back foot to cover point
down off, tight line, the batsman lets that one go through
seemed to release that one late from his fingers, slanting it up fullish and driven out to the covers
rises up from a good length on off and is defended down
on middle and leg, tucked easily off the pads and some smooth running follows
outside off, good length, the batsman steps out of his crease to push to the covers
pushed through outside off, left alone
right up there and defended on the back foot
right up there and pushed back into the covers
short ball fired in, hit the back arm  and Kapugedera just stands there, hard as nails
turned off the legs into short midwicket
pushed through outside off, left alone
pushed through again outside off, but was a touch wide and the batsman could have tried to cut it
outside off, and that's a shot and a half, the batsman just waiting and lifting a cover drive way on its way. Nice batwork
short and wide down off, left alone once more
pushed across the left hander who defends on the front foot
outside off, turned into the leg-side to short midwicket
on off, turned towards short midwicket once again
nipped back in from outside off, defended down
outside off, played down to gully and thrown back in for a direct hit at the striker's end from the second slipper Ponting, but the batsman was well home
shot, Sangakkara pushing forward with a ramrod straight face of the bat back past the bowler
starts with one which pitches on off and middle, turns back out to off, and is in turn moved out to short midwicket
turned back down off the outside edge to third man
defended on the front foot
comes out to swish outside off
driven out to mid-off
right up there on off, driven out to long-off
turned off the legs to midwicket without much fuss
rocks back into line outside off stump and performs a regulation back-foot defence
on middle and off, turned back off the legs behind square
outside off, overpitched, and driven out to mid-off
pitched on off, driven out to mid-off for an easy single
short ball goes over the batsman's head as he ducks
up there on off, pushed back to mid-on on the toes and bring up the 100
up there on off, driven out to mid-on
right up there and defended on the front foot
beat the outside edge this time
up there and defended on the front foot
driven out square of point
pushed across the left hander, Hopes continues to be economical
gives him plenty of room to cut through the covers
nips back in to the right hander on off, defended tidily, Australia tightening their hold
outside off, driven hard back to the bowler, so straight it hit the stumps and crashed out to mid-on
pulled through midwicket this time
on middle and leg, turned off the legs to midwicket
this one really turned and squared him up, as well as pitching up, defended on the back foot
this time defended on the front foot
worked out from outside off to short mdiwcket where Hayden runs, gets a hand on it and then grabs it
on off, turned to short midwicket this time
driven out to mid-on, an easy steer of a single
waits on the back foot and defends in the line
played on the back foot back to the bowler
pushed forward
a half-shout for one which would have gone on down leg
defended this time
dropped. Another one, and this was Matthew Hayden at first slip as well, good pace on that, the batsman flashes hard to Hayden's left and it was on to him too quickly
driven straight to the covers
defended now
driven out to the covers this time
top timing through the covers and the ball races on
a touch of width and well played to midwicket
waited and driven out to mid-off this time
worked out again
worked out again outside off
big rise outside off, let that one pop through to the keeper
outside off, squares up and a thin outside edge goes past the waiting slips
outside off, rises, and played carefully into the covers off the back foot
outside off, dealt with fairly effectively
pushed across the right hander who plays it back down off the back foot defensively
outside off, walks into the line of the ball and tries to force it off the back foot
paddled round to short midwicket this time
on leg, a touch of room, turned round in front of square leg
short ball, tucked down off the legs and they decide, wisely I expect, not to risk the single
on middle and leg, good length, played back down
tucked off the back foot well into the covers and it's well run in the end
driven out to the covers and tidily picked up
driven straight to Symonds at cover, no run
outside off, pushed down the line, left alone
pushed forward this time
and again
squared up and there's little he can do as he's pushed on to the back foot other than defend
pushed through on the back foot now
worked into the line and defends out towards mid-off
outside off and Sangakkara leans forward into a drive of a thick edge down through the vacant slips and it's tidied inside the rope by the third man running round
searing yorker at 152.5kph, well dug out
full delivery, squeezed out to point and they run through
banged in short, Sangakkara leans back limbo-like to flash a back-foot steer to third man and it bounces just in front
outside off, driven out through point and some good running results
nipped back in from outside off and squeezed out in front of square to bring up the fifty partnership
Sangakkara steps forward, then back, and turns the ball behind square
outside off, chopped back down into the gully, for a quick single to bring up Sangakkara's well-worked fifty
gone! Hopes breaks the stand as he sends in a short and straight one which the batsman hoicks off his nose over to midwicket where Hussey takes the catch
rocks back into the line in front of middle, defended down
tries for the sweep
defended now
outside off, pulled to midwicket but doesn't get hold of it really
outside off, soft hands to guide it out to third man, and gets it past the fielder who runs on and crashes into the boards
right up there, defended on the front foot
driven forward to steal the strike after a useful over for Sri Lanka who still need around six an over
pushed across the left hander who defends on the front foot
pushed across the left hander with a hint of room outside off, driven out to the covers
outside off and that's through him past the blade as he shapes to push from the back foot
outside off, the batsman comes out of his crease and drives hard through the covers, that should have been stopped there by Haddin after Symonds missed it first up
a defensive this time
comes out, looking to attack but ends up defending on the front foot
outside off, swept hard onto the leg side
driven forward this time
a touch of width but some hard-to-deal-with bounce, nonetheless it's clipped with a cut to point off the back foot
outside off, gets right over the ball and drives through mid-off
right up there on middle and off, pushed out to mid-on
cracking ball pitches on middle and rips, while popping, past the outside edge
driven out forward, played well there
outside off, driven out to mid-off where a direct shy still wouldn't have been out
outside off, driven to the covers this time
outside off, the batsman comes out to meet the ball, drives to the covers
banged in short and looped in the air off the bat with a scoop up to short square leg, the batsman not at all getting over it or controlling it
outside off, cut hard through third man
reaches right out to sweep right round to midwicket
down the ground and Sangakkara chips well over long-off, just in front of Lee to bring up the 150
a hint of width, cut hard in front of point
driven out hard through mid-off
too good, turned past him from leg and fizzes on past the edge
right up there and driven into the ground. Gilchrist likes it, doesn't he? "Yes, Hogg"
nipped back in from outside off, pushed to the leg side
outside off, too wide, Sanga flashes a hard drive out to the covers but it's picked up
turns back in from outside off, driven out through mid-on
pushed across the right hander, a tight one, poked into the covers
outside off, wide and turning wider, that's a fair call
slower ball on off, there was a mix-up there as both batsmen ended up at the wrong end, Ponting at first slip should have instead thrown to Symonds at the bowler's end
turned into the legs now
down on one knee and sweeps high to deep midwicket where Haddin takes a cool catch
cut not particularly well, high up in the air in fact and Gilchrist takes a few steps forward for an easy catch
swivels it in on middle and defended forward with a tight bat
outside off, driven into the ground and it went up to the covers where Hussey got his body behind it
a big appeal for one which pitched outside off and took an edge in front of the pad
right over the ball and defends
on off, pushes out in front of midwicket
driven out to mid-on this time
driven out to the covers now
right up there on leg, pushed forward at it but a little bit too late on the shot
outside off, pulled high over Symonds' head at midwicket, who runs round to take it, the ball coming up off the top edge, done by pace, and there's another duck
low full toss, possibly deliberate, pushed out to the covers
extraordinary shot, the sort of thing you'd expect from Dhoni, coming down, going to lap sweep and works it over his shoulder
nips back in from outside off, pitches up and is defended back down
attempted flipper ends up wide down leg
tossed up on leg, reaches out to sweep it back round to short midwicket
worked out to the covers on the front foot
pushed past him outside off
backs away, looking to cut it, misses, the ball goes through and nearly takes the bail, only just wide
swings back in to the right hander, who drives out in front of short midwicket
on off, played down off the back foot to mid-off
outside off, and Malinga backs away to try to open up the off-side and doesn't connect - in fact, he's nowhere near connecting
pushed across the right hander again and he backs away once more
round the wicket, it shapes away just at the last moment, too good for the retreating Malinga
again, another play and miss
driven out to the covers
the wrong'un's not picked this time
down the track and drives out to mid-on
picks the wrong'un this time but that's still little help as the ball pitches past him
paddled round in front of midwicket where Haddin tidies up inside the rope, but his hand connects with the rope at the same time
pitches on off and moves away from him, the wrong'un once more
outside off, driven back to mid-off
big swing in to the left hander who drives out on the leg-side and they settle for one after Malinga sent Sangakkara back
boomeranged back in from outside off, the batsman backs away as is customary this innings, but he's just too wide outside off
more of the same, you sense that all he has to do is land it on the stumps and he will bowl him
full one, towards leg this time - but now it's too much down leg
and that's the one he's been seeking, gets it on target at last and Malinga is comprehensively bowled as he backs away and exposes his stumps
follows him down off, Sangakkara looks to try to work it to midwicket
driven out to wide mid-off now

Lee finally gets a wicket which means he's taken a wicket in all international matches this summer. Sangakkara backs away to try to drive to mid-off and is bowled by a swinging yorker which clinks into leg
